titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Fred B. Rogers (b. 1926) was Professor of Preventive Medicine at the Temple University School of Medicine. He received his M.M.S. in Internal Medicine from the University of Pennsylvania and his M.D. from Temple University. Rogers was the author of numerous articles and books on medical history.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Fred B. Rogers. Materials include; research notes, manuscripts, reprints, and related correspondence on a variety of scientific, biographical, and medical history topics; texts of addresses and related correspondence; course materials and lecture notes during his time at Temple Medical School; bound volumes of Rogers's medical school lab notes, lecture notes, and case reports; notebooks containing notes on patient visits and a prescription formulary (1948-1949); diplomas, awards, and certificates; transcriptions of interviews with Rogers; a small collection of letters to Lawrence H. Rogers (Fred Rogers's father); postcards from Rogers to his family written while he was in the Navy; a collection of handbills of faith healers and fortune tellers in Philadelphia, 1979-1989; a copy of Rogers's 1951 University of Pennsylvania thesis "Painless Myocardial Infarction"; and notes and correspondence related to the Victor Robinson lecture series at Temple University Medical School.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
